title: Cold Chain: Keeping Things Fresh
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cold Chain: Keeping Things Fresh.

hook.text: Pfizer's COVID vaccine needed storage at -70Â°C. A broken cold chain meant wasted doses and lost lives.

buildup.text: A cold chain is a temperature-controlled supply chain for perishable goods: food, medicine, chemicals.

discovery.text: One temperature deviation at any point â€” truck, warehouse, store â€” can spoil the entire shipment.

twist.text: The cold chain consumes enormous energy. Refrigerated transport accounts for about 15% of global fossil fuel use.

climax.text: IoT sensors now monitor temperature in real time, alerting operators the moment a threshold is breached.

punchline.text: The chain is only as cold as its weakest link.

quiz.question: What is a cold chain?
options: A temperature-controlled supply chain for perishable goods
A chain used in cold climates only
A supply chain for metals and minerals
